Shoe Goo is a vinyl base product that is incredibly useful as a semi-flexible glue for lots of different type of plastics. The best shoe repairs are done using Shoe Goo and scraps of fabric, as the product itself does not permeate materials like leather very well.

Years ago after a long stretch of unemployment I had to take a minimum wage temp job at a glass factory. In one department where we boxed up mirrors, we had these big industrial hot glue guns to glue boxes shut after putting mirrors in them. I saw workers in there, whose boots had gotten worn out to the point of getting holes in them, use the glue guns and coat the outside of their boots in hot glue. Just a temp fix that would usually only last that one day and you'd have to do it again the next day; but when you're broke enough.
